Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable
This class provides all the data and mechanics needed to play "Campuses and Puzzles" game.

    • clickedTwoButtons

      private static java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition clickedTwoButtons
      Condition variable to reactivate the color matching loop when 2 buttons are clicked. Provides synchronization by preventing busy waiting.

    • getRandomColor

      private java.awt.Color getRandomColor()
      Returns a random color from 3 colors which used in the game (red, blue, green)
      Returns:
      A random color.

      Initializes the java swing frame of the game

      Initialize the main panel of the game.

    • matchFound

      private boolean matchFound()
      Checks if the board has any matches.
      Returns:
      True if board has any matches.

    • clearMatchingColors

      private ColorMatch clearMatchingColors()
      Clears the matching colors in the table after a move.
      Returns:
      True if any color match found and cleared.

    • fillEmptyColors

      private boolean fillEmptyColors()
      Shifts the colors to empty fields and make new colors appear from the bottom of the board
      Returns:
      True if any empty fields found and filled in the board.

    • resetColorBoard

      private void resetColorBoard()
      Clears matches and fills the board.

    • matchColorsAndFillBoard

      private boolean matchColorsAndFillBoard()
      Clears matching colors and fills the empty spaces in the board in a loop enabling cascaded matches.
      Returns:
      True if any change made to the board.

    • damageStep

      private void damageStep​(ColorMatch match, int charI, CharacterBox[] enemy, java.lang.String enemyName)
      Calculates and deals the damage given by match to the corresponding character.
      Parameters:
      match - Color match.
      charI - Index of the character.
      enemy - Enemies that the damage will be dealt to.
      enemyName - Name of the enemy.

    • switchClickedColors

      private boolean switchClickedColors()
      If clicked colors in the board are adjacent, switches them witch each other.
      Returns:
      True colors are switched.

    • sleep

      private void sleep​(int n)
      Sleeps for n milliseconds. Slows the game for the user to understand what is going on with the matches and the filling of the board.
      Parameters:
      n - Sleeping time in milliseconds

    • boardLoop

      private void boardLoop()
      Creates a color board with no matching colors at the start. Then takes their moves from the users, matches the colors, fills the empty spaces in the board, applies the damages to corresponding characters. And loops.

    • userTurn

      private void userTurn()
      User makes a move until he/she clicks a valid combination of colors.

    • enemyTurn

      private void enemyTurn()
      Enemy makes a move.

    • enemyRandMove

      private EnemyMove enemyRandMove()
      Makes a random move.
      Returns:
      Returns the properties of the move for later use.

    • takeEnemyRandMoveBack

      private void takeEnemyRandMoveBack​(EnemyMove move)
      Takes the move back made by enemy if it is not a valid move.
      Parameters:
      move - The move which will be taken back.

    • checkWinCond

      private void checkWinCond()
      Checks if any of the players won. If they did resets the characters and restarts the game.

    • calcDamage

      public int calcDamage​(ColorMatch match, CharacterBox enemy)
      Calculates the damage dealt to character according to some specific properties given in the pdf.
      Parameters:
      match - Color match which gives damage to the character.
      enemy - Character which takes damage.
      Returns:
      Calculated damage.
